trans-unit.source: Represents a dialog box form that contains a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl"></xref> for printing from a Windows Forms application.
When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values.
For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> class.
When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
You can change the value for this property at run time.
Gets or sets the button on the form that is clicked when the user presses the ENTER key.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property allows you to designate a default action that occurs when the user presses the ENTER key in your application.
The button assigned to this property must be an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IButtonControl> that is on the current form or located within a container on the current form.

You can use this property, for example, to allow the user to quickly navigate a simple form by allowing them to press the ENTER key when they are finished instead of manually clicking the accept button with their mouse.
The accept button might not be activated if the currently selected control on the form intercepts the ENTER key and processes it.
For example, a multiline text box control allows the ENTER key to be pressed when it is selected to insert a new line character in the control.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IButtonControl"></xref> that represents the button to use as the accept button for the form.
Gets or sets the accessible description of the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The accessible description of the control.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the accessible name of the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The accessible name of the control.
The default is `null`.
The accessible role of the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.Default"></xref>.
Gets or sets whether the control can accept data that the user drags onto it.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`true` if drag-and-drop operations are allowed in the control; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the anchor style for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AnchorStyles"></xref> values.
The default is `Top` and `Left`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form adjusts its size to fit the height of the font used on the form and scales its controls.
You can use this property to allow your form and its controls to automatically adjust based on changes in the font.
This can be useful in applications where the font might increase or decrease based on the language specified for use by Windows.
To obtain the size the form will auto scale to, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.AutoScaleBaseSize%2A> property.
If you want to determine the size the form will auto scale to based on a specific font, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.GetAutoScaleSize%2A> method.
`true` if the form will automatically scale itself and its controls based on the current font assigned to the form; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> class does not support the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.AutoScaleBaseSize"></xref> property.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Stores an ordered pair of integers, typically the width and height of a rectangle.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form enables autoscrolling.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Represents a Boolean value.
Gets or sets the size of the auto-scroll margin.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The auto-scroll margin is used to determine the distance from the edges of the scrollable control.
If the distance from the edge of a child control to parent-scrollable control is less than the value assigned to this property, the appropriate scroll bar is displayed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the height and width, in pixels, of the auto-scroll margin.
Gets or sets the minimum size of the automatic scroll bars.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.AutoScrollMinSize%2A> property is used to manage the screen size allocated to the automatic scroll bars.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the minimum height and width, in pixels, of the scroll bars.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> should automatically resize to fit its contents.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.AutoSize%2A> property has no affect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> control.
`true` if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> should resize to fit its contents; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.AutoSize"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets how the control performs validation when the user changes focus to another control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Determines how a control validates its data when it loses user input focus.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.AutoValidate"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the background color of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor"></xref> property.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.BackColor"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the background image for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> that represents the image to display in the background of the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the layout of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.BackgroundImage"></xref>.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.BackgroundImageLayout%2A> property has no affect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.BackgroundImageLayout"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the cancel button for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Allows a control to act like a button on a form.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether entering the control causes validation for all controls that require validation.
`true` if entering the control causes validation to be performed on controls requiring validation; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.CausesValidation"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the shortcut menu for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu"></xref> that represents the shortcut menu associated with the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ContextMenu"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets how the short cut menu for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> for this control, or `null` if there is no <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> property changes.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a control box is displayed in the caption bar of the form.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ControlBox%2A> property is set to `true`, the control box is displayed in the upper-left corner of the caption bar.
The control box is where the user can click to access the system menu.
If your form does not display a control box, the form is not able to close using the ALT+F4 keyboard combination.
`true` if the form displays a control box in the upper-left corner of the form; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Creates the handle for the form that encapsulates the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref>.
For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.CreateHandle%2A> method, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The printer settings in <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document"></xref> are not valid.
Gets or sets the cursor for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref> that represents the cursor to display when the mouse pointer is over the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Cursor"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets the data bindings for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.DataBindings%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlBindingsCollection>.
By adding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> objects to the collection, you can bind any property of a control to the property of an object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ControlBindingsCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Binding"></xref> objects for the control.
Gets the default minimum size, in pixels, of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> control.

Unless overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.DefaultMinimumSize%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Size> with a <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Width%2A> of 370 pixels and a <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Height%2A> of 300 pixels.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> structure representing the default minimum size.
Gets or sets how the control should be docked in its parent control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle.None"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Dock"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPadding"></xref> property.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges"></xref> that represents the padding for all the edges of a docked control.
Gets or sets the document to preview.
This property is equivalent to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> representing the document to preview.
Get or sets a value indicating whether the control is enabled.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`true` if the control is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Enabled"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the font used for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to the text displayed by the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultFont"></xref> property.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Font"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The foreground <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultForeColor"></xref> property.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ForeColor"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the border style of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The border style of the form determines how the outer edge of the form appears.
In addition to changing the border display for a form, certain border styles prevent the form from being sized.
For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName> border style changes the border of the form to that of a dialog box and prevents the form from being resized.
The border style can also affect the size or availability of the caption bar section of a form.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle"></xref> that represents the style of border to display for the form.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle.Sizable"></xref>.
The value specified is outside the range of valid values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a **Help** button should be displayed in the caption box of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
When this property is set to `true`, a small button with a question mark appears in the caption bar to the left of the **Close** button.
You can use this button to display Help for your application.

You can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.HelpRequested> event of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class to display Help information to the user when the **Help** button of the form is clicked.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.HelpButton%2A> property is ignored if the maximize or minimize boxes are shown.
`true` to display a **Help** button in the form's caption bar; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the icon for the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A form's icon designates the picture that represents the form in the taskbar, as well as the icon that is displayed for the control box of the form.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> that represents the icon for the form.
Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode.Inherit"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> enumeration values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.ImeMode"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form is a container for multiple document interface (MDI) child forms.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property changes the display and behavior of the form to an MDI parent form.
When this property is set to `true`, the form displays a sunken client area with a raised border.
All MDI child forms assigned to the parent form are displayed within its client area.
`true` if the form is a container for MDI child forms; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form will receive key events before the event is passed to the control that has focus.
This property is not relevant for this class.

When this property is set to `true`, the form will receive all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp> events.
After the form's event handlers have completed processing the keystroke, the keystroke is then assigned to the control with focus.
You can use this property to process all keystrokes in your application and either handle the keystroke or call the appropriate control to handle the keystroke.
For example, when an application uses function keys, you might want to process the keystrokes at the form level rather than writing code for each control that might receive keystroke events.
If a form has no visible or enabled controls, it automatically receives all keyboard events.
`true` if the form will receive all key events; `false` if the currently selected control on the form receives key events.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the control relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents the upper-left corner of the control relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Location"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the margins for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> representing the space between controls.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Margin"></xref> property changes.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the maximize button is displayed in the caption bar of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A maximize button enables users to enlarge a window to full-screen size.

To display a maximize button, you must also set the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> property to either <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.
A maximize button automatically becomes a restore button when a window is maximized.
Minimizing or restoring a window automatically changes the restore button back to a maximize button.
Maximizing a form at run time generates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property reflects the current state of the window.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState.Maximized>, the form is maximized independently of whatever settings are in effect for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MaximizeBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> properties
`true` to display a maximize button for the form; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the maximum size the form can be resized to.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property enables you to limit the size of a form to a specified maximum size.
You can use this feature when displaying multiple windows at the same time to ensure that a single window does not cause other windows to be hidden.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the maximum size for the form.
The values of the height or width within the <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> are less than 0.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MaximumSize"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu"></xref> that is displayed in the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
You can use this property to switch between complete menu sets at run time.

For example, you can define one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> to be displayed when your multiple document interface (MDI) form has no active MDI child forms and another <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> to display when a child window is displayed.
You can also use a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> when specific conditions that require displaying a different menu set exist in your application.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu"></xref> that represents the menu to display in the form.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the minimize button is displayed in the caption bar of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A minimize button enables users to minimize a window to an icon.

To display a minimize button, you must also set the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> property to either <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.
Minimizing a form at run time generates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property reflects the current state of the window.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.WindowState%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState?displayProperty=fullName>, the form is minimized independently of whatever settings are in effect for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MinimizeBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.FormBorderStyle%2A> properties.
`true` to display a minimize button for the form; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets the minimum size the form can be resized to.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property enables you to limit the size of a form to a specified minimum size.
You can use this feature to prevent a user from sizing a window to an undesirable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the minimum size for the form.
The values of the height or width within the <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> are less than 0.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.MinimumSize"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form.Closing"></xref> event.
This method is not relevant for this class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.OnClosing%2A> method invalidates the preview so it is regenerated when the dialog is reopened.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.OnClosing%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Provides data for a cancelable event.
Gets or sets the opacity level of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> class does not use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Opacity%2A> property.
The level of opacity for the control.
Gets or sets the padding for the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> representing the control's internal spacing characteristics.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Padding"></xref> property changes.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Gets a value indicating the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl"></xref> contained in this form.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl"></xref> contained in this form.
Determines whether a key should be processed further.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Keys?displayProperty=fullName> key values will return `false`; otherwise, processing is passed to the base class's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.ProcessDialogKey%2A> method.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values.
`true` to indicate the key should be processed; otherwise, `false`.
Processes the TAB key.
`true` to cycle forward through the controls in the form; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate the TAB key was successfully processed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft.Inherit"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeft"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> should be laid out from right to left.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeftLayout%2A> property is used for applications where the language is written from right to left.

When both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeftLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeft%2A> properties are `true`, mirroring will be turned on for the dialog box, and control placement and text will be from right to left.
`true` to indicate the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> contents should be laid out from right to left; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.RightToLeftLayout"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form is displayed in the Windows taskbar.
This property is not relevant for this class.
If a form is a child of another form, the child form is not displayed in the Windows taskbar.
You can use this property to prevent users from selecting your form through the Windows taskbar.

For example, if you display a **Find and Replace** tool window in your application, you might want to prevent that window from being selected through the Windows taskbar, since you would need both the application's main window and the **Find and Replace** tool window displayed in order to process searches appropriately.
`true` to display the form in the Windows taskbar at run time; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the size of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.

This property allows you to set both the height and width of the form at the same time instead of setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> properties individually.

If you want to set the size and location of a form, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.DesktopBounds%2A> property to size and locate the form based on desktop coordinates or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Bounds%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class to set the size and location of the form based on screen coordinates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size of the form.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Size"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the style of the size grip to display in the lower-right corner of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the style of the size grip to display in the lower-right corner of the form.
Gets or sets the starting position of the dialog box at run time.
This property enables you to set the starting position of the form when it is displayed at run time.
The form can be displayed manually or in the default location specified by Windows.
You can also position the form to display in the center of the screen or in the center of its parent form for forms such as multiple document interface (MDI) child forms.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FormStartPosition"></xref> that represents the starting position of the dialog box.
The value specified is outside the range of valid values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key.
This property is not relevant for this class.
When the user presses the TAB key, the input focus is set to the next control in the tab order.
Controls with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.TabStop%2A> property value of `false` are not included in the collection of controls in the tab order.
The tab order can be manipulated by setting the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TabIndex%2A> property value.
`true` if the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.TabStop"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the object that contains data about the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Retrieves or assigns the data currently associated with the tree node.
Any object-derived type can be assigned to this property.
If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.
An object that contains data about the control.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the text displayed on the control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Text"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form should be displayed as the topmost form of your application.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A topmost form is a form that overlaps all the other forms even if it is not the active or foreground form.
Topmost forms are always displayed at the highest point in the z-order of an application.
You can use this method to create a form that is always displayed in your application, such as a **Find and Replace** tool window.
`true` to display the form as a topmost form; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the color that will represent transparent areas of the form.
This property is not relevant for this class.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property is assigned a <xref:System.Drawing.Color>, the areas of the form that have the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> will be displayed transparently.
Any mouse actions, such as the click of the mouse, that are performed on the transparent areas of the form will be transferred to the windows below the transparent area.
For example, if the client region of a form is made transparent, clicking the mouse on that area will send the event notification of the click to any window that is below it.
If the color assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property is the same as any controls on the form, they also will be displayed transparently.

For example, if you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control on a form that has its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TransparencyKey%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.Control%2A>, the control will be displayed transparently unless the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control is changed to a different color.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the color to display transparently on the form.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether printing uses the anti-aliasing features of the operating system.
Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.

The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Document%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.UseAntiAlias%2A> properties.
The example assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `TreeView1` that contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> objects.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Tag%2A> property of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode> object must be set to a fully qualified document name that can be accessed by the machine running the example.

Set each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a string that identifies the file specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
For example, you could set `TreeNode1.Tag` to "c:\myDocuments\recipe.doc" and `TreeNode1.Text` to "recipe.doc".
The example also assumes the form contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> named `PrintPreviewDialog1` and a button named `Button1`.
To run this example, call the `InitializePrintPreviewDialog` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.

[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview/CPP/form1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview/CS/form1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewAndPrintPreview/VB/form1.vb#3)]
`true` if anti-aliasing is used; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the wait cursor, typically an hourglass shape.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`true` to use the wait cursor for the current control and all child controls; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is visible.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`true` if the control is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog.Visible"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the form's window state.

Before a form is displayed, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.WindowState%2A> property is always set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState?displayProperty=fullName>, regardless of its initial setting.

This is reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Top%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> property settings.

If a form is hidden after it has been shown, these properties reflect the previous state until the form is shown again, regardless of any changes made to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.WindowState%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState"></xref> that represents the window state of the form.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FormWindowState.Normal"></xref>.
The value specified is outside the range of valid values.
